&nbsp;</td>
<td id=".amt.4" style=
"width: 14%; text-align: right; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin-left: 0pt;">
<em data-td-fact-id="30496548" style=
"font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">1</em></td>
<td id=".trail.4" nowrap="true" style=
"width: 1%; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin-left: 0pt;">
&nbsp;</td>
</tr>
<tr style=
"vertical-align: bottom; background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255);">
<td style=
"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt;">
<p style=
"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;">
Total</p>
</td>
<td id=".lead.2" style=
"width: 1%; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt;">
&nbsp;</td>
<td id=".symb.2" style=
"width: 1%; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt;">
&nbsp;</td>
<td id=".amt.2" style=
"width: 14%; text-align: right; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin-left: 0pt;">
<em data-td-fact-id="30496549" style=
"font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">15</em></td>
<td id=".trail.2" nowrap="true" style=
"width: 1%; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin-left: 0pt;">
&nbsp;</td>
<td id=".lead.3" style=
"width: 1%; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt;">
&nbsp;</td>
<td id=".symb.3" style=
"width: 1%; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt;">
&nbsp;</td>
<td id=".amt.3" style=
"width: 14%; text-align: right; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin-left: 0pt;">
<em data-td-fact-id="30496550" style=
"font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">463</em></td>
<td id=".trail.3" nowrap="true" style=
"width: 1%; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin-left: 0pt;">
&nbsp;</td>
<td id=".lead.4" style=
"width: 1%; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt;">
&nbsp;</td>
<td id=".symb.4" style=
"width: 1%; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt;">
&nbsp;</td>
<td id=".amt.4" style=
"width: 14%; text-align: right; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin-left: 0pt;">
<em data-td-fact-id="30496551" style=
"font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">478</em></td>
<td id=".trail.4" nowrap="true" style=
"width: 1%; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin-left: 0pt;">
&nbsp;</td>
</tr>
</table>
</div>
<p style=
"font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;">
&nbsp;</p>
<p style=
"font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;">
*U-Swirl cafés and the brands franchised by U-Swirl have
historically utilized a development area sales model. The result is
that many areas are under development and the rights to open cafés
within the development areas have been established, but there is
<em data-td-fact-id="30497104" style=
"font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">no</em> assurance that
any individual development area will result in a determinable
number of café openings.</p>
<p style=
"font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;">
&nbsp;</p>
<div data-thunderdome-xbrl-exclude="1" id="PGBK" style=
"width: 100%; margin-left: 0pt; margin-right: 0pt">
<div id="PGNUM" style=
"text-align: center; width: 100%; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt;">
40</div>
<hr style=
"PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always; border: none; width: 100%; height: 2px; color: #000000; background-color: #000000" />

<div id="PGHDR" style="text-align: left; width: 100%"><a href=
"#toc">Table of Contents</a></div>
</div>
<p style=
"font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: left">
&nbsp;</p>
<p style=
"font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;">
<i>Consolidation</i></p>
<p style=
"font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;">
&nbsp;</p>
<p style=
"font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;">
Management accounts for the activities of the Company and its
subsidiaries, and the accompanying consolidated financial
statements include the accounts of the Company and its
subsidiaries. As described above, on <em data-td-invalid-detail="1"
style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">January 14,
2013,</em> the Company acquired a controlling interest in SWRL.
Prior to <em data-td-invalid-detail="1" style=
"font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">January 14, 2013,</em>
the Company’s consolidated financial statements excluded the
financial information of SWRL. Beginning on
<em data-td-invalid-detail="1" style=
"font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">January 14, 2013,</em>
the results of operations, assets and liabilities of SWRL have been
included in these consolidated financial statements. The Company
foreclosed on all of the outstanding stock of U-Swirl
International, Inc. as of <em data-td-invalid-detail="1" style=
"font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">February</em>
<em data-td-fact-id="30497105" style=
"font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">29,</em>
<em data-td-fact-id="30497106" style=
"font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">2016</em> in full
satisfaction of the amounts owed under the SWRL Loan Agreement.
This resulted in U-Swirl becoming a wholly-owned subsidiary of the
Company as of <em data-td-invalid-detail="1" style=
"font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">February</em>
<em data-td-fact-id="30497107" style=
"font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">29,</em>
<em data-td-fact-id="30497108" style=
"font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">2016</em> and
concurrently the Company ceased to have financial control of
U-Swirl, Inc. as of <em data-td-invalid-detail="1" style=
"font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">February</em>
<em data-td-fact-id="30497109" style=
"font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">29,</em>
<em data-td-fact-id="30497110" style=
"font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">2016.</em> As of
<em data-td-invalid-detail="1" style=
"font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">February</em>
<em data-td-fact-id="30497111" style=
"font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">29,</em>
<em data-td-fact-id="30497112" style=
"font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">2016,</em> U-Swirl,
Inc. had <em data-td-fact-id="30497113" style=
"font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">no</em> assets. All
intercompany balances and transactions have been eliminated in
consolidation.</p>
<p style=
"font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;">
&nbsp;</p>
<p style=
"font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;">
<i>Cash Equivalents</i></p>
<p style=
"font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;">
&nbsp;</p>
<p style=
"font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;">
The Company considers all highly liquid instruments purchased with
an original maturity of <em data-td-fact-id="30497114" style=
"font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">six</em> months or less
to be cash equivalents. The Company continually monitors its
positions with, and the credit quality of, the financial
institutions with which it invests. As of the balance sheet date,
and periodically throughout the year, the Company has maintained
balances in various operating accounts in excess of federally
insured limits. This amount was approximately <em data-td-fact-id=
"30497115" style=
"font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">$5.6</em> million at
<em data-td-invalid-detail="1" style=
"font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">February 28,
2018.</em></p>
<p style=
"font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;">
&nbsp;</p>
<p style=
"font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;">
<i>Accounts</i> <i>and Notes</i> <i>Receivable</i></p>
<p style=
"font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;">
&nbsp;</p>
<p style=
"font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;">
In the normal course of business, the Company extends credit to
customers, primarily franchisees that satisfy pre-defined credit
criteria. The Company believes that it has limited concentration of
credit risk primarily because its receivables are secured by the
assets of the franchisees to which the Company ordinarily extends
credit, including, but <em data-td-fact-id="30497116" style=
"font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">not</em> limited to,
their franchise rights and inventories. An allowance for doubtful
accounts is determined through analysis of the aging of accounts
receivable, assessments of collectability based on historical
trends, and an evaluation of the impact of current and projected
economic conditions. The process by which the Company performs its
analysis is conducted on a customer by customer, or franchisee by
franchisee, basis and takes into account, among other relevant
factors, sales history, outstanding receivables, customer financial
strength, as well as customer specific and geographic market
factors relevant to projected performance. The Company monitors the
collectability of its accounts receivable on an ongoing basis by
assessing the credit worthiness of its customers and evaluating the
impact of reasonably likely changes in economic conditions that
<em data-td-invalid-detail="1" style=
"font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">may</em> impact credit
risks. Estimates with regard to the collectability of accounts
receivable are reasonably likely to change in the future. At
<em data-td-invalid-detail="1" style=
"font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">February 28, 2018,</em>
the Company has <em data-td-fact-id="30497117" style=
"font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">$368,023</em> of notes
receivable outstanding and an allowance for doubtful accounts of
<em data-td-fact-id="30497118" style=
"font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">$26,500</em> associated
with these notes. The notes require monthly payments and bear
interest rates ranging from <em data-td-fact-id="30497119" style=
"font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">4.5%</em> to
<em data-td-fact-id="30497120" style=
"font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">6%.</em> The notes
mature through <em data-td-invalid-detail="1" style=
"font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">September 2022</em> and
approximately <em data-td-fact-id="30497121" style=
"font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">$349,000</em> of notes
receivable are secured by the assets financed.</p>
<p style=
"font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;">
&nbsp;</p>
<p style=
"font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;">
<i>Inventories</i></p>
<p style=
"font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;">
&nbsp;</p>
<p style=
"font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;">
Inventories are stated at the lower of cost or net realizable
value. An inventory reserve is established to reduce the cost of
obsolete, damaged and excess inventories to the lower of cost or
net realizable value based on actual differences. This inventory
reserve is determined through analysis of items held in inventory,
and, if the recorded value is higher than the market value, the
Company records an expense to reduce inventory to its actual market
value. The process by which the Company performs its analysis is
conducted on an item by item basis and takes into account, among
other relevant factors, market value, sales history and future
sales potential. Cost is determined using the <em data-td-fact-id=
"30497122" style=
"font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">first</em>-in,
<em data-td-fact-id="30497123" style=
"font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">first</em>-out
method.</p>
<p style=
"font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;">
&nbsp;</p>
<p style=
"font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;">
<i>Property and Equipment and Other Assets</i></p>
<p style=
"font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;">
&nbsp;</p>
<p style=
"font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif;font-size:10pt;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-left:0pt;margin-right:0.9pt;margin-top:0pt;text-align:justify;">
Property and equipment are recorded at cost. Depreciation and
amortization are computed using the straight-line method based upon
the estimated useful life of the asset, which range from
<em data-td-fact-id="30497124" style=
"font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">five</em> to
<em data-td-fact-id="30497125" style=
"font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">thirty-nine</em> years.
Leasehold improvements are amortized on the straight-line method
over the lives of the respective leases or the service lives of the
improvements, whichever is shorter.</p>
<p style=
"font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;">
&nbsp;</p>
<p style=
"font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;">
The Company reviews its long-lived assets through analysis of
estimated fair value, including identifiable intangible assets,
whenever events or changes indicate the carrying amount of such
assets <em data-td-invalid-detail="1" style=
"font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">may</em>
<em data-td-fact-id="30497126" style=
"font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">not</em> be
recoverable. The Company’s policy is to review the recoverability
of all assets, at a minimum, on an annual basis.</p>
<p style=
"font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;">
&nbsp;</p>
<p style=
"font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;">
<i>Income Taxes</i></p>
<p style=
"font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;">
&nbsp;</p>
<p style=
"font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;">
The Company provides for income taxes pursuant to the liability
method. The liability method requires recognition of deferred
income taxes based on temporary differences between financial
reporting and income tax bases of assets and liabilities, using
current enacted income tax rates and regulations. These differences
will result in taxable income or deductions in future years when
the reported amount of the asset or liability is recovered or
settled, respectively. Considerable judgment is required in
determining when these events <em data-td-invalid-detail="1" style=
"font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">may</em> occur and
whether recovery of an asset, including the utilization of a net
operating loss or other carryforward prior to its expiration, is
more likely than <em data-td-fact-id="30497127" style=
"font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">not.</em> Due to
historical U-Swirl losses, prior to FY <em data-td-fact-id=
"30497128" style=
"font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">2016</em> the Company
established a full valuation allowance on the Company’s deferred
tax assets. During FY <em data-td-fact-id="30497129" style=
"font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">2016</em> the Company
took possession of the outstanding equity in U-Swirl. As a result
of the Company’s ownership increasing to <em data-td-fact-id=
"30497130" style=
"font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">100%,</em> the Company
began filing consolidated income tax returns in FY
<em data-td-fact-id="30497131" style=
"font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">2017.</em> Because of
this change, the Company has recognized the full value of deferred
tax assets that had full valuation allowances prior to FY
<em data-td-fact-id="30497132" style=
"font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">2016.</em> During the
<em data-td-fact-id="30497133" style=
"font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">fourth</em> quarter of
FY <em data-td-fact-id="30497134" style=
"font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">2017</em> the Company
further evaluated the value of deferred tax assets and determined
that the assets are restricted due to a limitation on the
deductibility of future losses in accordance with Section
<em data-td-fact-id="30497135" style=
"font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">382</em> of the
Internal Revenue Code as a result of the foreclosure transaction.
The correction of this immaterial error to the Company’s balance
sheet is further described in Note <em data-td-fact-id="30497136"
style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">16.</em> The
Company's temporary differences are listed in Note
<em data-td-fact-id="30497137" style=
"font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">6.</em></p>
<p style=
"font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;">
&nbsp;</p>
<div data-thunderdome-xbrl-exclude="1" id="PGBK" style=
"width: 100%; margin-left: 0pt; margin-right: 0pt">
<div id="PGNUM" style=
"text-align: center; width: 100%; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt;">
41</div>
<hr style=
"PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always; border: none; width: 100%; height: 2px; color: #000000; background-color: #000000" />

<div id="PGHDR" style="text-align: left; width: 100%"><a href=
"#toc">Table of Contents</a></div>
</div>
<p style=
"font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: left">
&nbsp;</p>
<p style=
"font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;">
<i>Gift</i> <i>C</i><i>ard</i> <i>B</i><i>reakage</i></p>
<p style=
"font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;">
&nbsp;</p>
<p style=
"font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;">
The Company and its franchisees sell gift cards that are redeemable
for product in our stores. The Company manages the gift card
program, and therefore collects all funds from the activation of
gift cards and reimburses franchisees for the redemption of gift
cards in their stores. A liability for unredeemed gift cards is
included in accounts payable and accrued liabilities in the balance
sheets.</p>
<p style=
"font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;">
&nbsp;</p>
<p style=
"font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;">
There are <em data-td-fact-id="30497138" style=
"font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">no</em> expiration
dates on the Company’s gift cards, and the Company does
<em data-td-fact-id="30497139" style=
"font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">not</em> charge any
service fees. While the Company’s franchisees continue to honor all
gift cards presented for payment, the Company
<em data-td-invalid-detail="1" style=
"font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">may</em> determine the
likelihood of redemption to be remote for certain cards due to long
periods of inactivity. The Company is in the process of obtaining a
legal opinion regarding the necessity to submit unclaimed property
to any states and is accumulating sufficient historical redemption
patterns to calculate breakage estimates related to unredeemed gift
cards. This breakage rate is based on a percentage of sales when
the likelihood of the redemption of the gift card becomes remote.
When the Company has sufficient historical redemption patterns to
calculate breakage estimates, the gift card breakage will be
recognized over the same performance period, and in the same
proportion, that the Company’s data has demonstrated that gift
cards are redeemed. As the Company is in the process of obtaining a
legal opinion regarding the necessity to submit unclaimed property
to any states and is accumulating sufficient historical redemption
patterns to calculate breakage estimates, the Company did
<em data-td-fact-id="30497140" style=
"font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">not</em> recognize gift
card breakage during the year ended <em data-td-invalid-detail="1"
style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">February 28,
2018</em> or <em data-td-fact-id="30497141" style=
"font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">2017.</em> Accrued gift
card liability was <em data-td-fact-id="30497142" style=
"font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">$3,057,131</em> and
<em data-td-fact-id="30497143" style=
"font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">$2,921,585</em> at
<em data-td-invalid-detail="1" style=
"font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">February 28, 2018</em>
and <em data-td-fact-id="30497144" style=
"font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">2017,</em>
respectively.</p>
<p style=
"font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;">
&nbsp;</p>
<p style=
"font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;">
<i>Goodwill</i></p>
<p style=
"font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;">
&nbsp;</p>
<p style=
"font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;">
Goodwill arose from <em data-td-fact-id="30497145" style=
"font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">three</em> transaction
types. The <em data-td-fact-id="30497146" style=
"font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">first</em> type was the
result of the incorporation of the Company after its inception as a
partnership. The goodwill recorded was the excess of the purchase
price of the Company over the fair value of its assets. The Company
has allocated this goodwill equally between its Franchising and
Manufacturing operations. The <em data-td-fact-id="30497147" style=
"font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">second</em> type was
the purchase of various retail stores, either individually or as a
group, for which the purchase price was in excess of the fair value
of the assets acquired. Finally, goodwill arose from business
acquisitions, where the fair value of the consideration given for
acquisition exceeded the fair value of the identified assets net of
liabilities.</p>
<p style=
"font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;">
&nbsp;</p>
<p style=
"font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;">
The Company performs a goodwill impairment test on an annual basis
or more frequently when events or circumstances indicate that the
carrying value of a reporting unit more likely than
<em data-td-fact-id="30497148" style=
"font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">not</em> exceeds its
fair value. Recoverability of goodwill is evaluated through
comparison of the fair value of each of the Company’s reporting
units with its carrying value. To the extent that a reporting unit’
s carrying value exceeds the implied fair value of its goodwill, an
impairment loss is recognized. On <em data-td-invalid-detail="1"
style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">February</em>
<em data-td-fact-id="30497149" style=
"font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">29,</em>
<em data-td-fact-id="30497150" style=
"font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">2016</em> RMCF
repossessed all stock in U-Swirl International, Inc. pledged as
collateral on the Loan Agreement with SWRL. This was the result of
SWRL’s inability to repay the Loan Agreement and inability to cure
defaults of financial covenants. As of <em data-td-invalid-detail=
"1" style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">February</em>
<em data-td-fact-id="30497151" style=
"font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">29,</em>
<em data-td-fact-id="30497152" style=
"font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">2016,</em> U-Swirl had
<em data-td-fact-id="30497153" style=
"font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">$1,930,529</em> of
goodwill recorded as a result of past business acquisitions. In the
<em data-td-fact-id="30497154" style=
"font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">fourth</em> quarter of
FY <em data-td-fact-id="30497155" style=
"font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">2016,</em> RMCF
performed a test of impairment as a result of the change in
ownership and the result of the Company’s test indicated a full
impairment of the U-Swirl goodwill. The Company’s testing and
impairment is described in Note <em data-td-fact-id="30497156"
style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">13</em> to the
financial statements.</p>
<p style=
"font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;">
<i>&nbsp;</i></p>
<p style=
"font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;">
<i>Franchise Rights</i></p>
<p style=
"font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;">
&nbsp;</p>
<p style=
"font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;">
Franchise rights arose from the entry into agreements to acquire
substantially all of the franchise rights of Yogurtini,
CherryBerry, Fuzzy Peach, Let’s Yo! and Yogli Mogli. Franchise
rights are amortized over a period of <em data-td-fact-id=
"30497157" style=
"font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">20</em> years.</p>
<p style=
"font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:left;">
&nbsp;</p>
<p style=
"font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:left;">
<i>Insurance and Self-Insurance Reserves</i></p>
<p style=
"font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:left;">
<i>&nbsp;</i></p>
<p style=
"font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;">
The Company uses a combination of insurance and self-insurance
plans to provide for the potential liabilities for workers’
compensation, general liability, property insurance, director and
officers’ liability insurance, vehicle liability and employee
health care benefits. Liabilities associated with the risks that
are retained by the Company are estimated, in part, by considering
historical claims experience, demographic factors, severity factors
and other assumptions. While the Company believes that its
assumptions are appropriate, the estimated accruals for these
liabilities could be significantly affected if future occurrences
and claims differ from these assumptions and historical trends.</p>
<p style=
"font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;">
<i>&nbsp;</i></p>
<p style=
"font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;">
<i>Sales</i></p>
<p style=
"font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;">
&nbsp;</p>
<p style=
"font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;">
Sales of products to franchisees and other customers are recognized
at the time of delivery. Sales of products to franchisees and other
customers are made at standard prices, without any bargain sales of
equipment or supplies. Sales of products at retail stores are
recognized at the time of sale.</p>
<p style=
"font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;">
<i>&nbsp;</i></p>
<div data-thunderdome-xbrl-exclude="1" id="PGBK" style=
"width: 100%; margin-left: 0pt; margin-right: 0pt">
<div id="PGNUM" style=
"text-align: center; width: 100%; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt;">
42</div>
<hr style=
"PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always; border: none; width: 100%; height: 2px; color: #000000; background-color: #000000" />

<div id="PGHDR" style="text-align: left; width: 100%"><a href=
"#toc">Table of Contents</a></div>
</div>
<p style=
"font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: left">
&nbsp;</p>
<p style=
"font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;">
<i>Rebates</i></p>
<p style=
"font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;">
&nbsp;</p>
<p style=
"font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;">
Rebates received from purveyors that supply products to the Company’
s franchisees are included in franchise royalties and fees. Product
rebates are recognized in the period in which they are earned.
Rebates related to Company-owned locations are offset against
operating costs.</p>
<p style=
"font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;">
&nbsp;</p>
<p style=
"font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;">
<i>Shipping Fees</i></p>
<p style=
"font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;">
&nbsp;</p>
<p style=
"font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;">
Shipping fees charged to customers by the Company’s trucking
department are reported as sales. Shipping costs incurred by the
Company for inventory are reported as cost of sales or
inventory.</p>
<p style=
"font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;">
&nbsp;</p>
<p style=
"font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;">
<i>Franchise and Royalty Fees</i></p>
<p style=
"font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;">
&nbsp;</p>
<p style=
"font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;">
Franchise fee revenue is recognized upon opening of the franchise
store. In addition to the initial franchise fee, the Company also
recognizes a marketing and promotion fee of <em data-td-fact-id=
"30497158" style=
"font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">one</em> percent
(<em data-td-fact-id="30497159" style=
"font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">1%</em>) of franchised
stores’ gross retail sales and a royalty fee based on gross retail
sales. Beginning with Rocky Mountain Chocolate Factory franchise
store openings in the <em data-td-fact-id="30497160" style=
"font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">third</em> quarter of
FY <em data-td-fact-id="30497161" style=
"font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">2004,</em> the Company
modified its royalty structure. Under the current structure, the
Company recognizes <em data-td-fact-id="30497162" style=
"font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">no</em> royalty on
franchised stores’ retail sales of products purchased from the
Company and recognizes a <em data-td-fact-id="30497163" style=
"font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">ten</em> percent
(<em data-td-fact-id="30497164" style=
"font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">10%</em>) royalty on
all other sales of product sold at franchise locations. For
franchise stores opened prior to the <em data-td-fact-id="30497165"
style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">third</em>
quarter of FY <em data-td-fact-id="30497166" style=
"font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">2004</em> the Company
recognizes a royalty fee of <em data-td-fact-id="30497167" style=
"font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">five</em> percent
(<em data-td-fact-id="30497168" style=
"font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">5%</em>) of franchised
stores’ gross retail sales. Royalty fees for U-Swirl cafés are
based on the rate defined in the acquired contracts for the
franchise rights and range from <em data-td-fact-id="30497169"
style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">2.5%</em> to
<em data-td-fact-id="30497170" style=
"font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">6%</em> of gross retail
sales.</p>
<p style=
"font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;">
&nbsp;</p>
<p style=
"font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;">
In certain instances, the Company is required to pay a portion of
franchise fee revenue, or royalty fees to parties the Company has
contracted with to assist in developing and growing a brand. The
agreements generally include Development Agents, or commissioned
brokers who are paid a portion of the initial franchise fee, a
portion of the ongoing royalty fees, or both. When such agreements
exist, the Company reports franchise fee and royalty fee revenues
net of the amount paid, or due, to the agent/broker.</p>
<p style=
"font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;">
&nbsp;</p>
<p style=
"font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;">
<i>Use of Estimates</i></p>
<p style=
"font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;">
&nbsp;</p>
<p style=
"font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;">
In preparing consolidated financial statements in conformity with
accounting principles generally accepted in the United States of
America, management is required to make estimates and assumptions
that affect the reported amounts of assets, liabilities, the
disclosure of contingent assets and liabilities, at the date of the
consolidated financial statements, and revenues and expenses during
the reporting period. Actual results could differ from those
estimates.</p>
<p style=
"font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;">
&nbsp;</p>
<p style=
"font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;">
<i>Vulnerability Due to Certain Concentrations</i></p>
<p style=
"font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;">
&nbsp;</p>
<p style=
"font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;">
Revenue from <em data-td-fact-id="30497171" style=
"font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">one</em> customer of
the Company’s Manufacturing segment represented approximately
<em data-td-fact-id="30497172" style=
"font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">$5.1</em> million or
<em data-td-fact-id="30497173" style=
"font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">13%</em> of the Company’
s revenues during the year ended <em data-td-invalid-detail="1"
style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">February 28,
2018.</em> The Company’s future results <em data-td-invalid-detail=
"1" style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">may</em> be
adversely impacted by a change in the purchases of this
customer.</p>
<p style=
"font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;">
&nbsp;</p>
<p style=
"font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;">
<i>Stock-Based Compensation</i></p>
<p style=
"font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;">
&nbsp;</p>
<p style=
"font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;">
At <em data-td-invalid-detail="1" style=
"font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">February 28, 2018,</em>
the Company had stock-based compensation plans, which currently
consists solely of the Company’s <em data-td-fact-id="30497174"
style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">2007</em> Equity
Incentive Plan, for employees and non-employee directors which
authorized the granting of stock awards.</p>
<p style=
"font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;">
&nbsp;</p>
<p style=
"font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;">
The Company recognized <em data-td-fact-id="30497175" style=
"font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">$591,839,</em>
<em data-td-fact-id="30497176" style=
"font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">$584,893,</em> and
<em data-td-fact-id="30497177" style=
"font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">$763,094</em> related
equity-based compensation expense during the years ended
<em data-td-invalid-detail="1" style=
"font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">February 28</em> or
<em data-td-fact-id="30497178" style=
"font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">29,</em>
<em data-td-fact-id="30497179" style=
"font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">2018,</em>
<em data-td-fact-id="30497180" style=
"font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">2017</em> and
<em data-td-fact-id="30497181" style=
"font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">2016,</em>
respectively. Compensation costs related to share-based
compensation are generally recognized over the vesting period.</p>
<p style=
"font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;">
&nbsp;</p>
<p style=
"font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;">
Beginning <em data-td-invalid-detail="1" style=
"font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">March 1, 2017,</em> the
Company adopted ASU <em data-td-fact-id="30497182" style=
"font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">No.</em>
<em data-td-fact-id="30497183" style=
"font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">2019</em>-<em data-td-fact-id="30497184"
style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">09,</em> which
requires recognition of excess tax benefits and tax deficiencies in
the income statement. Prior to <em data-td-invalid-detail="1"
style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">March 1,
2017</em> tax benefits or expense resulting from the difference in
the compensation cost recognized for stock options are reported as
financing cash flows in the accompanying Statements of Cash Flows.
The excess tax benefit or (expense) included in net cash provided
by financing activities for the years ended
<em data-td-invalid-detail="1" style=
"font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">February 28</em> or
<em data-td-fact-id="30497185" style=
"font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">29,</em>
<em data-td-fact-id="30497186" style=
"font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">2017</em> and
<em data-td-fact-id="30497187" style=
"font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">2016</em> was
$(<em data-td-fact-id="30497188" style=
"font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">34,128</em>) and
<em data-td-fact-id="30497189" style=
"font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">$19,868,</em>
respectively.</p>
<p style=
"font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;">
&nbsp;</p>
<p style=
"font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;">
During FY <em data-td-fact-id="30497190" style=
"font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">2018</em> and
<em data-td-fact-id="30497191" style=
"font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">2017,</em> the Company
granted <em data-td-fact-id="30497192" style=
"font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">no</em> restricted
stock units. There were <em data-td-fact-id="30497193" style=
"font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">no</em> stock options
granted to employees during FY <em data-td-fact-id="30497194"
style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">2018</em> or FY
<em data-td-fact-id="30497195" style=
"font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">2017.</em> The
restricted stock unit grants generally vest <em data-td-fact-id=
"30497196" style=
"font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">17</em>-<em data-td-fact-id="30497197"
style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">20%</em> annually
over a period of <em data-td-fact-id="30497198" style=
"font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">five</em> to
<em data-td-fact-id="30497199" style=
"font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">six</em> years. The
Company recognized <em data-td-fact-id="30497200" style=
"font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">$532,739</em> of
consolidated stock-based compensation expense related to these
grants during FY <em data-td-fact-id="30497201" style=
"font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">2018</em> compared with
<em data-td-fact-id="30497202" style=
"font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">$564,473</em> in FY
<em data-td-fact-id="30497203" style=
"font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">2017.</em> Total
unrecognized stock-based compensation expense of non-vested,
non-forfeited shares granted, as of <em data-td-invalid-detail="1"
style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">February 28,
2018</em> was <em data-td-fact-id="30497204" style=
"font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">$620,753,</em> which is
expected to be recognized over the weighted average period of
<em data-td-fact-id="30497205" style=
"font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">1.3</em> years.</p>
<p style=
"font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;">
&nbsp;</p>
<p style=
"font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;">
The Company did <em data-td-fact-id="30497206" style=
"font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">not</em> issue any
fully vested, unrestricted shares of stock to non-employee
directors during the year ended <em data-td-invalid-detail="1"
style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">February 28,
2018</em> compared to <em data-td-fact-id="30497207" style=
"font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">2,000</em> shares
issued during the year ended <em data-td-invalid-detail="1" style=
"font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">February 28, 2017.</em>
In connection with these non-employee director stock issuances, the
Company recognized <em data-td-fact-id="30497208" style=
"font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">$0</em> and
<em data-td-fact-id="30497209" style=
"font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">$20,420</em> of
stock-based compensation expense during year ended
<em data-td-invalid-detail="1" style=
"font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">February 28, 2018</em>
and <em data-td-fact-id="30497210" style=
"font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">2017,</em>
respectively.</p>
<p style=
"font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;">
&nbsp;</p>
<p style=
"font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;">
During the year ended <em data-td-invalid-detail="1" style=
"font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">February 28, 2018,</em>
the Company issued <em data-td-fact-id="30497211" style=
"font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">5,000</em> shares of
common stock under the Company’s equity incentive plan to an
independent contractor providing information technology consulting
services to the Company. These shares were issued as a part of the
compensation for services rendered to the Company by the
contractor. Associated with this unrestricted stock award, the
Company recognized <em data-td-fact-id="30497212" style=
"font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">$59,100</em> in
stock-based compensation expense during the year ended
<em data-td-invalid-detail="1" style=
"font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">February 28,
2018.</em></p>
<p style=
"font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;">
&nbsp;</p>
<div data-thunderdome-xbrl-exclude="1" id="PGBK" style=
"width: 100%; margin-left: 0pt; margin-right: 0pt">
<div id="PGNUM" style=
"text-align: center; width: 100%; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt;">
43</div>
<hr style=
"PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always; border: none; width: 100%; height: 2px; color: #000000; background-color: #000000" />

<div id="PGHDR" style="text-align: left; width: 100%"><a href=
"#toc">Table of Contents</a></div>
</div>
<p style=
"font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: left">
&nbsp;</p>
<p style=
"font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;">
<i>Earnings</i> <i>P</i><i>er Share</i></p>
<p style=
"font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;">
&nbsp;</p>
<p style=
"font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;">
Basic earnings per share is computed as net earnings divided by the
weighted average number of common shares outstanding during each
year. Diluted earnings per share reflects the potential dilution
that could occur from common shares issuable through stock options
and restricted stock units. Following the expiration of all
outstanding options, during FY <em data-td-fact-id="30497213"
style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">2018</em> and FY
<em data-td-fact-id="30497214" style=
"font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">2017,</em>
<em data-td-fact-id="30497215" style=
"font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">no</em> stock options
were excluded from diluted shares. During FY <em data-td-fact-id=
"30497216" style=
"font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">2016,</em>
<em data-td-fact-id="30497217" style=
"font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">12,936</em> of stock
options were excluded from diluted shares as their effect was
anti-dilutive.</p>
<p style=
"font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;">
<i>&nbsp;</i></p>
<p style=
"font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;">
<i>Advertising and Promotional Expenses</i></p>
<p style=
"font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;">
&nbsp;</p>
<p style=
"font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;">
The Company expenses advertising costs as incurred. Total
advertising expense for RMCF amounted to <em data-td-fact-id=
"30497218" style=
"font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">$355,678,</em>
<em data-td-fact-id="30497219" style=
"font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">$279,698,</em> and
<em data-td-fact-id="30497220" style=
"font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">$215,314</em> for the
fiscal years ended <em data-td-invalid-detail="1" style=
"font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">February 28</em> or
<em data-td-fact-id="30497221" style=
"font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">29,</em>
<em data-td-fact-id="30497222" style=
"font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">2018,</em>
<em data-td-fact-id="30497223" style=
"font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">2017</em> and
<em data-td-fact-id="30497224" style=
"font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">2016,</em>
respectively. Total advertising expense for U-Swirl and its brands
amounted to <em data-td-fact-id="30497225" style=
"font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">$222,093,</em>
<em data-td-fact-id="30497226" style=
"font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">$335,771,</em> and
<em data-td-fact-id="30497227" style=
"font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">$460,034</em> for the
fiscal years ended <em data-td-invalid-detail="1" style=
"font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">February 28</em> or
<em data-td-fact-id="30497228" style=
"font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">29,</em>
<em data-td-fact-id="30497229" style=
"font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">2018,</em>
<em data-td-fact-id="30497230" style=
"font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">2017</em> and
<em data-td-fact-id="30497231" style=
"font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">2016,</em>
respectively.</p>
<p style=
"font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;">
&nbsp;</p>
<p style=
"font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;">
<i>Fair Value of Financial Instruments</i></p>
<p style=
"font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;">
&nbsp;</p>
<p style=
"font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;">
The Company’s financial instruments consist of cash and cash
equivalents, trade receivables, payables, notes payable and notes
receivable. The fair value of all instruments approximates the
carrying value, because of the relatively short maturity of these
instruments.</p>
<p style=
"font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;">
&nbsp;</p>
<p style=
"font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;">
<i>Recent Accounting Pronouncements</i></p>
<p style=
"font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;">
&nbsp;</p>
<p style=
"font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;">
In <em data-td-invalid-detail="1" style=
"font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">June 2016,</em> the
FASB issued ASU <em data-td-fact-id="30497232" style=
"font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">2016</em>-<em data-td-fact-id="30497233"
style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">13,</em>
Financial Instruments - Credit Losses (Topic <em data-td-fact-id=
"30497234" style=
"font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">326</em>): Measurement
of Credit Losses on Financial Instruments. ASU <em data-td-fact-id=
"30497235" style=
"font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">2016</em>-<em data-td-fact-id="30497236"
style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">13</em>
significantly changes the impairment model for most financial
assets and certain other instruments. ASU <em data-td-fact-id=
"30497237" style=
"font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">2016</em>-<em data-td-fact-id="30497238"
style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">13</em> will
require immediate recognition of estimated credit losses expected
to occur over the remaining life of many financial assets, which
will generally result in earlier recognition of allowances for
credit losses on loans and other financial instruments. ASU
<em data-td-fact-id="30497239" style=
"font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">2016</em>-<em data-td-fact-id="30497240"
style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">13</em> is
effective for the Company's fiscal year beginning
<em data-td-invalid-detail="1" style=
"font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">March 1, 2020</em> and
subsequent interim periods. The Company is currently evaluating the
impact the adoption of ASU <em data-td-fact-id="30497241" style=
"font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">2016</em>-<em data-td-fact-id="30497242"
style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">13</em> will have
on the Company's consolidated financial statements.</p>
<p style=
"font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;">
&nbsp;&nbsp;</p>
<p style=
"font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;">
In <em data-td-invalid-detail="1" style=
"font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">February 2016,</em> the
FASB issued ASU <em data-td-fact-id="30497243" style=
"font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">2016</em>-<em data-td-fact-id="30497244"
style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">02,</em> Leases
(Topic <em data-td-fact-id="30497245" style=
"font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">842</em>), which
requires the recognition of lease assets and lease liabilities on
the balance sheet by lessees for those leases currently classified
as operating leases under ASC <em data-td-fact-id="30497246" style=
"font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">840</em> “Leases.”
These amendments also require qualitative disclosures along with
specific quantitative disclosures. These amendments are effective
for fiscal years beginning after <em data-td-invalid-detail="1"
style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">December 15,
2018,</em> including interim periods within those fiscal years.
Early application is permitted. Entities are required to apply the
amendments at the beginning of the earliest period presented using
a modified retrospective approach. The Company expects that
substantially all of its operating lease commitments will be
subject to the new guidance and will be recognized as operating
lease liabilities and right-of-use assets upon adoption. The
Company anticipates ASU <em data-td-fact-id="30497247" style=
"font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">2016</em>-<em data-td-fact-id="30497248"
style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">02</em> will have
a material impact on the consolidated balance sheet. The impact of
ASU <em data-td-fact-id="30497249" style=
"font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">2016</em>-<em data-td-fact-id="30497250"
style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">02</em> is
non-cash in nature, as such, it will <em data-td-fact-id="30497251"
style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">not</em> affect
the Company’s cash flows. The Company is currently evaluating the
impact of ASU <em data-td-fact-id="30497252" style=
"font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">2016</em>-<em data-td-fact-id="30497253"
style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">02</em> on the
consolidated statements of income.</p>
<p style=
"font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;">
&nbsp;</p>
<p style=
"font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;">
In <em data-td-invalid-detail="1" style=
"font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">January 2016,</em> the
FASB issued ASU <em data-td-fact-id="30497254" style=
"font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">2016</em>-<em data-td-fact-id="30497255"
style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">01,</em>
Financial Instruments - Overall (Subtopic <em data-td-fact-id=
"30497256" style=
"font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">825</em>-<em data-td-fact-id="30497257"
style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">10</em>),
Recognition and Measurement of Financial Assets and Financial
Liabilities, which addresses certain aspects of recognition,
measurement, presentation, and disclosure of financial instruments.
ASU <em data-td-fact-id="30497258" style=
"font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">2016</em>-<em data-td-fact-id="30497259"
style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">01</em> will be
effective for us in the <em data-td-fact-id="30497260" style=
"font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">first</em> quarter of
the Company’s fiscal year <em data-td-fact-id="30497261" style=
"font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">2019,</em> and early
adoption is <em data-td-fact-id="30497262" style=
"font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">not</em> permitted. The
Company is currently evaluating the impact that the standard will
have on its consolidated financial statements.</p>
<p style=
"font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;">
&nbsp;</p>
<p style=
"font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;">
In <em data-td-invalid-detail="1" style=
"font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">May 2014,</em> the FASB
issued ASU <em data-td-fact-id="30497263" style=
"font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">No.</em>
<em data-td-fact-id="30497264" style=
"font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">2014</em>-<em data-td-fact-id="30497265"
style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">09,</em> Revenue
from Contracts with Customers (Topic <em data-td-fact-id="30497266"
style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">606</em>). This
guidance, as amended by subsequent ASUs on the topic, supersedes
current guidance on revenue recognition in Topic
<em data-td-fact-id="30497267" style=
"font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">605,</em> Revenue
Recognition. This guidance will be effective for annual reporting
periods beginning after <em data-td-invalid-detail="1" style=
"font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">December 15, 2017,</em>
including interim reporting periods. Early application of the
guidance is permitted for annual reporting periods beginning after
<em data-td-invalid-detail="1" style=
"font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">December 31, 2016.</em>
This guidance is applicable to the Company's fiscal year beginning
<em data-td-invalid-detail="1" style=
"font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">March 1, 2018.</em> The
Company expects the adoption of the new guidance to change the
timing of recognition of initial franchise fees, including master
license and territory fees for the Company’s international
business, and renewal fees. Currently, these fees are generally
recognized upfront upon either opening of the respective franchise
store or entry into a license agreement. The new guidance will
generally require these fees to be recognized over the term of the
related agreement, which the Company expects will result in a
material impact to revenue recognized for franchise fees, license
fees and renewal fees; the Company is still in the process of
quantifying the material impact. The Company does
<em data-td-fact-id="30497268" style=
"font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">not</em> expect this
new guidance to materially impact the recognition of royalty income
or sales of products. The Company is continuing to evaluate the
impact the adoption of this new guidance will have on these and
other revenue transactions, as well as the presentation of
marketing and advertising fee revenues and expenses, in addition to
the impact on accounting policies and related disclosures.&nbsp;
The Company anticipates that contract fulfillment costs under ASC
Topic <em data-td-fact-id="30497269" style=
"font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">606</em> will have
<em data-td-fact-id="30497270" style=
"font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">no</em> material impact
to the Company's consolidated statements of income and statements
of cash flows. The Company's current policy is to recognize initial
franchise fees when a franchise location opens or at the start of a
new agreement term. In accordance with the new guidance, the
initial franchise services are <em data-td-fact-id="30497271"
style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">not</em> distinct
from the continuing rights or services offered during the term of
the franchise agreement, and will be treated as a single
performance obligation. As a result, initial fees received will
most likely be recognized over the franchise term. The cumulative
adjustment to be recorded as contract liabilities, upon adoption,
is expected to be approximately <em data-td-fact-id="30497272"
style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">15%</em> of the
Company's consolidated total liabilities. <em data-td-fact-id=
"30497273" style=
"font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">No</em> impact to the
Company's consolidated statements of cash flows is expected as the
initial fees will continue to be collected upon the signing of the
franchise agreement or the beginning of a new franchise term.</p>
<p style=
"font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;">
&nbsp;</p>
<div data-thunderdome-xbrl-exclude="1" id="PGBK" style=
"width: 100%; margin-left: 0pt; margin-right: 0pt">
<div id="PGNUM" style=
"text-align: center; width: 100%; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt;">
44</div>
<hr style=
"PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always; border: none; width: 100%; height: 2px; color: #000000; background-color: #000000" />

"#toc">Table of Contents</a></div>

<p style=
"font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: left">
&nbsp;</p>
</div>

<td id=".symb.2" style=

$</td>
<td id=".amt.2" style=

<em data-td-fact-id="30496562" style=
"font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">4,842,474</em></td>
<td id=".trail.2" nowrap="true" style=

"width: 1%; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin-left: 0pt;">
&nbsp;</td>
</tr>
</table>
</div>
<p style=
"font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;">
&nbsp;</p>
</div>
<div contenteditable="false" docsect="9" id="18015" sectdesc=
"Note to Financial Statements">&nbsp;</div>
<div data-td-parse-id="1" data-td-statement-type="note"
data-td-v2v-id="1525553115751" id="thunderdome-statement-883860">
<p style=
"font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;">
NOTE <em data-td-fact-id="30497276" style=
"font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">4</em> - LINE OF CREDIT
AND LONG-TERM DEBT</p>
<p style=
"font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;">
&nbsp;</p>
<p style=
"font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;">
Line of Credit</p>
<p style=
"font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;">
&nbsp;</p>
<p style=
"font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;">
At <em data-td-invalid-detail="1" style=
"font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">February 28, 2018,</em>
the Company had a <em data-td-fact-id="30497277" style=
"font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">$5</em> million working
capital line of credit from Wells Fargo Bank, N.A., collateralized
by substantially all of the Company’s assets with the exception of
the Company’s retail store assets. Draws
<em data-td-invalid-detail="1" style=
"font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">may</em> be made under
the line at <em data-td-fact-id="30497278" style=
"font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">50%</em> of eligible
accounts receivable plus <em data-td-fact-id="30497279" style=
"font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">50%</em> of eligible
inventories. Interest on borrowings is at LIBOR plus
<em data-td-fact-id="30497280" style=
"font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">2.25%</em>
(<em data-td-fact-id="30497281" style=
"font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">3.9%</em> at
<em data-td-invalid-detail="1" style=
"font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">February 28,
2018).</em> At <em data-td-invalid-detail="1" style=
"font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">February 28, 2018,</em>
<em data-td-fact-id="30497282" style=
"font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">$5</em> million was
available for borrowings under the line of credit, subject to
borrowing base limitations. Additionally, the line of credit is
subject to various financial ratio and leverage covenants. At
<em data-td-invalid-detail="1" style=
"font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">February 28, 2018,</em>
the Company was in compliance with all such covenants. The credit
line is subject to renewal in <em data-td-invalid-detail="1" style=
"font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">September 2019</em> and
the Company believes it is likely to be renewed on terms similar to
current terms.</p>
<p style=
"font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;">
&nbsp;</p>
<p style=
"font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;">
Effective <em data-td-invalid-detail="1" style=
"font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">January 16, 2014,</em>
the Company entered into a business loan agreement with Wells Fargo
Bank, N.A. (the “Wells Fargo Loan Agreement”) for a
<em data-td-fact-id="30497283" style=
"font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">$7.0</em> million
long-term line of credit to be used to loan money to SWRL to fund
the purchase price of business acquisitions by SWRL (the “Wells
Fargo Loan”). The Company made its <em data-td-fact-id="30497284"
style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">first</em> draw
of approximately <em data-td-fact-id="30497285" style=
"font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">$6.4</em> million on
the Wells Fargo Loan on <em data-td-invalid-detail="1" style=
"font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">January 16, 2014</em>
and the <em data-td-fact-id="30497286" style=
"font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">first</em> draw was the
amount outstanding at <em data-td-invalid-detail="1" style=
"font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">February 28, 2014.</em>
Interest on the Wells Fargo Loan is at a fixed rate of
<em data-td-fact-id="30497287" style=
"font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">3.75%</em> and the
maturity date is <em data-td-invalid-detail="1" style=
"font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">January 15, 2020.</em>
The Wells Fargo Loan <em data-td-invalid-detail="1" style=
"font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">may</em> be prepaid
without penalty at any time by the Company. The Wells Fargo Loan is
collateralized by substantially all of the Company’s assets,
including the SWRL Loan Agreement. Additionally, the Wells Fargo
Loan is subject to various financial ratio and leverage covenants.
The Wells Fargo Loan Agreement also contains customary
representations and warranties, covenants and acceleration
provisions in the event of a default by the Company.</p>
<p style=
"font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;">
&nbsp;</p>
<p style=
"font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;">
Long-term debt consists of the following at
<em data-td-invalid-detail="1" style=
"font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">February 28:</em></p>
<p style=
"font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;">
&nbsp;</p>
<div data-td-parse-id="1" data-td-taggable-table="table"
data-td-v2v-id="1525553115748" id="thunderdome-statement-883861">
<table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" class="finTable"

<div contenteditable="false" docsect="9" id="18016" sectdesc=
"Note to Financial Statements">&nbsp;</div>
<div data-td-parse-id="1" data-td-statement-type="note"
data-td-v2v-id="1525553125167" id="thunderdome-statement-883863">
<p style=
"font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;">
NOTE <em data-td-fact-id="30497289" style=
"font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">5</em> – COMMITMENTS
AND CONTINGENCIES</p>
<p style=
"font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;">
&nbsp;</p>
<p style=
"font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;">
Operating Leases</p>
<p style=
"font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;">
&nbsp;</p>
<p style=
"font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;">
The Company conducts its retail operations in facilities leased
under non-cancelable operating leases of up to <em data-td-fact-id=
"30497290" style=
"font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">ten</em> years. Certain
leases contain renewal options for between <em data-td-fact-id=
"30497291" style=
"font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">five</em> and
<em data-td-fact-id="30497292" style=
"font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">ten</em> additional
years at increased monthly rentals. Some of the leases provide for
contingent rentals based on sales in excess of predetermined base
levels.</p>
<p style=
"font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;">
&nbsp;</p>
<p style=
"font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;">
The following is a schedule by year of future minimum rental
payments required under such leases for the years ending
<em data-td-invalid-detail="1" style=
"font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">February 28</em> or
<em data-td-fact-id="30497293" style=
"font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">29:</em></p>
<p style=
"font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;">
&nbsp;</p>
<div data-td-parse-id="1" data-td-taggable-table="table"
data-td-v2v-id="1525553125163" id="thunderdome-statement-883864">
<table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" class="finTable"

<td id=".trail.2" nowrap="true" style=

<tr style=

<td>2023</td>
<td id=".lead.2" style="width: 1%;">&nbsp;</td>
<td id=".symb.2" style="width: 1%;">&nbsp;</td>
<td id=".amt.2" style="width: 16%; text-align: right;">
<em data-td-fact-id="30496597" style=
"font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">49,000</em></td>
<td id=".trail.2" nowrap="true" style=
"width: 1%; margin-left: 0pt;">&nbsp;</td>
</tr>
<tr style=
"vertical-align: bottom; background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255);">
<td>Thereafter</td>
<td id=".lead.2" style="width: 1%;">&nbsp;</td>
<td id=".symb.2" style="width: 1%;">&nbsp;</td>
<td id=".amt.2" style="width: 16%; text-align: right;">
<em data-td-fact-id="30496598" style=
"font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">145,000</em></td>
<td id=".trail.2" nowrap="true" style=
"width: 1%; margin-left: 0pt;">&nbsp;</td>
</tr>
<tr style=
"vertical-align: bottom; background-color: rgb(204, 238, 255);">
<td>Total</td>
<td id=".lead.2" style="width: 1%;">&nbsp;</td>
<td id=".symb.2" style="width: 1%;">$</td>
<td id=".amt.2" style="width: 16%; text-align: right;">
<em data-td-fact-id="30496599" style=
"font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">1,136,000</em></td>
<td id=".trail.2" nowrap="true" style=
"width: 1%; margin-left: 0pt;">&nbsp;</td>
</tr>
</table>
</div>
<p style=
"font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;">
&nbsp;</p>
<p style=
"font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;">
The Company acts as primary lessee of some franchised store
premises, which the Company then subleases to franchisees, but the
majority of existing locations are leased by the franchisee
directly. The Company’s current policy is <em data-td-fact-id=
"30497294" style=
"font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">not</em> to act as
primary lessee on any further franchised locations, except in rare
instances. At <em data-td-invalid-detail="1" style=
"font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">March 31, 2018,</em>
the Company was the primary lessee at <em data-td-fact-id=
"30497295" style=
"font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">three</em> of the
Company’s <em data-td-fact-id="30497296" style=
"font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">297</em> domestic
franchised stores and <em data-td-fact-id="30497297" style=
"font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">1</em> former office
space.</p>
<p style=
"font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;">
&nbsp;</p>
<p style=
"font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;">
In some instances, the Company has leased space for its
Company-owned locations that are now occupied by franchisees. When
the Company-owned location was sold or transferred, the store was
subleased to the franchisee who is responsible for the monthly rent
and other obligations under the lease. The Company's liability as
primary lessee on sublet franchise outlets, all of which is fully
offset by sublease rentals, is as follows for the years ending
<em data-td-invalid-detail="1" style=
"font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">February 28</em> or
<em data-td-fact-id="30497298" style=
"font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">29:</em></p>
<p style=
"font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;">
&nbsp;</p>
<div data-td-parse-id="1" data-td-taggable-table="table"

<p style=
"font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;">
In FY <em data-td-fact-id="30497301" style=
"font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">2018,</em> the Company
renewed an operating lease for warehouse space in the immediate
vicinity of its manufacturing operation. The following is a
schedule, by year, of future minimum rental payments required under
such lease for the years ending <em data-td-invalid-detail="1"
style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">February 28</em>
or <em data-td-fact-id="30497302" style=
"font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">29:</em></p>
<p style=
"font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;">
&nbsp;</p>
<div data-td-parse-id="1" data-td-taggable-table="table"

<p style=
"font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;">
&nbsp;</p>
<p style=
"font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;">
Purchase contracts</p>
<p style=
"font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;">
&nbsp;</p>
<p style=
"font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;">
The Company frequently enters into purchase contracts of between
<em data-td-fact-id="30497306" style=
"font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">six</em> to
<em data-td-fact-id="30497307" style=
"font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">eighteen</em> months
for chocolate and certain nuts. These contracts permit the Company
to purchase the specified commodity at a fixed price on an
as-needed basis during the term of the contract. Because prices for
these products <em data-td-invalid-detail="1" style=
"font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">may</em> fluctuate, the
Company <em data-td-invalid-detail="1" style=
"font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">may</em> benefit if
prices rise during the terms of these contracts, but it
<em data-td-invalid-detail="1" style=
"font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">may</em> be required to
pay above-market prices if prices fall and it is unable to
renegotiate the terms of the contract. As of
<em data-td-invalid-detail="1" style=
"font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">February 28, 2018,</em>
the Company was contracted for approximately <em data-td-fact-id=
"30497308" style=
"font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">$529,000</em> of raw
materials under such agreements.</p>
<p style=
"font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;">
&nbsp;</p>
</div>

<p style=
"font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;">
&nbsp;</p>
<p style=
"font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;">
A reconciliation of the statutory federal income tax rate and the
effective rate as a percentage of pretax income is as follows for
the years ended <em data-td-invalid-detail="1" style=
"font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">February 28</em> or
<em data-td-fact-id="30497311" style=
"font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">29:</em></p>
<p style=
"font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;">
&nbsp;</p>

<td id=".trail.2" nowrap="true" style=

%</td>

)</td>

</div>
<p style=
"font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;">
&nbsp;</p>
<p style=
"font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;">
The components of deferred income taxes at
<em data-td-invalid-detail="1" style=
"font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">February 28</em> are as
follows:</p>
<p style=
"font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;">
